title: Liverpool transfer news and rumours: Reds join race for Malcom
description: All the latest Liverpool transfer news and rumours from across the British and European press on Wednesday, January 17.
content: Arsenal target Malcom could be off to Liverpool, according to Bordeaux manager Jocelyn Gourvennec in The Sun.The Brazil forward had been expected to join Arsenal in the January transfer window.Meanwhile, Simon Mignolet has admitted he must consider his Liverpool future after being dropped for Sunday's win over Manchester City, says the Daily Mail.The Belgium international, who is desperate to go to this summer's World Cup finals in Russia with his country, is understood to be interesting Napoli, reports the Liverpool Echo.Elsewhere, the Independent claims that the Reds are keeping close tabs on Stevenage defender Ben Wilmot, who has yet to agree a move to Tottenham Hotspur despite reports.The 18-year-old centre back only has a contract at Broadhall Way until the end of July, when the player will be available on a free transfer.Both Middlesbrough and Cardiff City want to take out-of-favour Liverpool midfielder Marko Grujic on a six-month loan deal, according to reports in ESPN, while AS says that Reds frontman Daniel Sturridge is now wanted by Sevilla as an alternative to Chelsea forward Michy Batshuayi.Finally, Jurgen Klopp has now joined the race for in-demand Norwich City midfielder James Maddison, reports the Evening Standard, and The Sun claims Leicester City playmaker Riyad Mahrez - who has reportedly been attracting the interest of Liverpool - wants to leave the King Power in the January window.
